website_summaries.verdict: This manual coffee grinder isn't as efficient as an electric model, but it gives you more choice over the grinding level, and it will last you a long time.
pros: Made of stainless steel and ceramic, so it won't break or wear out over time
Easily adjust the grind level to suit your preferences
cons: It takes a long time to grind and the results aren't always consistent

customer_reviews.title: The handle keeps falling off
customer_reviews.text: The handle keeps falling off. You can see the video. It drives me crazy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lada

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, Ergonomic Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This grinder caused me so much grief. Not only is it a pain to adjust the grind to begin with, after a few uses the top locking screw became so tight I would have to use pliers to undo it. Next, it’s actually a pain to hold. There’s no good place to put your hand so it puts a lot of strain on the wrist. If you want anything finer than French press you’re gonna be sore for the day. Speaking of grind size, I got plenty of different sizes... on one setting. A great way to ruin expensive beans. I got this grinder because it was cheaper than other hand grinders. Don’t be me.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Really good coffee with cheap beans!
customer_reviews.text: Great coffee - even with the relatively inexpensive "poor man's blend" beans -- and I enjoy the process of grinding it up this way. My husband had vetoed whole-bean coffee because of the price - but the cheap beans from Amazon convinced him to give it a try, and he loves the result too. No idea whether the ceramic heads really make a difference, but love the end product, and when I tried using the electric coffee grinder I normally use to grind up flax seeds, the coffee came out somewhat bitter, we thought.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney M

customer_reviews.title: I love to grind the beans by hand every morning
customer_reviews.text: This is my second manual grinder. My first got lost when I moved. I liked that one, which was made in Japan, but I like this one better. It is easier to grind. I set my grind for coarse, because I use a french press, and any fine grind would pass through the filter. It takes about 2 minutes to grind enough for 3 cups each day, and I can read something or watch the forest outside my window while I grind. No electricity necessary, so it works during power outages (I used to live in California). I am not a coffee connoisseur, but I have settled into this routine, and it suits me.
customer_reviews.author: BrianB

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Poorly made.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this coffee grinder... I have had it for 5 months now, and it has already broken down on me. The handle attachment is poorly made, the metal easily wore at a spot critical for grinding, and the overall product feels cheap. I would advise investing in a Hario if you're thinking about a hand grinder. Additionally, there is no option for customer support for this product. All in all-I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Beware the knob ...
customer_reviews.text: We were excited to get this grinder, since our old electric Cuisinart grinder broke, and we thought this could do a better French press grind. The grind was good, but on the fifth or sixth use the small knob on the handle popped off and isn't fixable. The knob is just glued on to the handle, or the metal pin the knob is attached with is super flimsy, not sure which. Bit it can't be reattached. It's hard to grind with just a flat metal bar to turn--poor handle construction. Expected better. If the knob had held up we would have given it a higher rating. We'll see what the customer service has to say ...
customer_reviews.author: Robert Williger

customer_reviews.title: Broke first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grind size consistency. Took several minutes to complete grind for 4 cups. Handle knob broke off first use, no paperwork came with it so took over an hour to call Amazon who informed me couldn’t ‘t get part, emailed me return label to send back the grinder. Whewh! Wasted over an hour of my time. (Previous reviewer had similar handle problem, so not going to order another from anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fitzhugh

customer_reviews.title: good coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: the only dislike I have is the coarse setting. There is no number to click to for a certain coarse, you simply adjust check, adjust check. So if you wanted to switch back and fourth from fine coffee grounds to coarse, it would be annoying. Other than that this is a great coffee grinder with a wide top to make it easy to fill with coffee beans. You will never go back to pre ground coffee after drinking a cup of freshly made coffee that you grinded. It is now a morning ritual that is well worth the extra minutes to be certain of delicious coffee every time. This is a reasonably priced grinder and seems to be made solid.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is stellar
customer_reviews.text: *after posting this review, ibwas sent a replacement handle without even having to request it. Excellent customer service wins me over every time. This is my first burr grinder and I love it for the most part. It takes a little experimentation to get the right grind since there are no markings indicating how tight to screw the pieces on. I was really disappointed that the knob on the handle came off this week. It seems poorly planned for a piece that get almost as much workout as the actual burr. The handle is the only reason I've marked this down. Grinds well, easy to store excess coffee grinds and fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best. Coffee. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is the key ingredient to fantastic coffee. I've used this daily for over a year: first drip, but now pour-over. I go about 9 stops out from all the way down, 1-1/2 turns. 10-11 make more fragrant coffee; 8 stronger but slower to pour. It does seem like a lot of work at first, but I've gotten used to it. I'm always done weighing and grinding before the water gets up to temperature. The thing is, you will never know coffee this good unless you have access to a very expensive electric conical grinder, which I don't. I've burned out three cheap blade grinders in 10 years. This makes much better coffee, and it may last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick S Bruckman

customer_reviews.title: My first manual grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder seems to work just as I intended. Adjustments to get the grind you want are easy to do. Yes if you want a finer grind it is going to take a bit longer than if you want a course grind but what did you expect. Grinding is easy with very little effort but takes longer than with an electric. To me that is not a big deal the whole object is to get a great cup of coffee, if it takes two minutes longer so what. I also will not have to replace my $125 electric grinder after a year!
customer_reviews.author: B. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions  note!
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad that the manufacturer put in a not for kids statement on the instructions .I would have immediately had grand kids turn the crank.! And... do not go counter clockwise! It buggers up the mechanical gears . I'm writing this on the plastic lid with a sharpie with an arrow >>>I think it should come that way. Lefty's h as ve it rough all over! Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy R

customer_reviews.title: THIS is the way to make coffee!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little burr grinder. Tailor the grind to exactly what you want, chat with a friend while grinding your coffee, and enjoy a terrific cuppa afterwards. I'd not be unhappy if the hopper were a little bigger, but aside from that it's perfect for my 10-cup pot. The silicone sock on the bottom of the jar does a good job of keeping the glass jar in place on the counter. Cleanup is easy, and the glass-and-ceramic construction prevent the annoying static buildup and grinders with steel burrs can create. I'm really happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Do the grind!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this product considering it's price. This is a hand grinder and does require a little elbow grease to hold down while grinding. I have found slight downward pressure on the handle is very helpful, but doesn't eliminate the occasional "rocking" or tipping of the grinder as the burrs catch a stubborn bean or two. In this age of instant gratification, it's nice to use a device that imposes a measure of self-control and discipline for a few moments! Excellent construction, solid materials and so far a very durable hand grinder. Would buy again and recommend but be prepared to have to do a grind!!
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: Simple design that works simply great!
customer_reviews.text: Whenever the power goes out, it's a bummer to be without good coffee :-) Had the beans, water and alternative fuel source but no feasible way to make the brew from beans. This little gadget works, and it does the job well. Gives just enough of a good arm workout - LOL! Seriously, the labor of manually grinding the beans won't wear anyone out. Highly recommended for campers, emergency preparations, and for those living off-grid.
customer_reviews.author: LovesAgoodRead

customer_reviews.title: The upgrade kit didn't fit (the circumference was too large ...
customer_reviews.text: The upgrade kit didn't fit (the circumference was too large to fit between the screw post on the grinder housing. In the instructions for the upgrade kit in Step 10 it says if your burr shaft is too large to fit past the threaded section, you can get a free replacement with a larger center hole.....So obviously in addition to the circumference of the upgrade kit being too large, you also may receive on that may not have a center hole big enough. I think the makers of Khaw-fee manual grinder need to just have these upgrade kits come with the grinder and they need to check that it works!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Like Electric Coffee Grinders
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a similar grinder to the Khaw-Fee a year ago and like it very much. I went back to Amazon to purchase another for travel and they don't offer that brand anymore so bought the Khaw-Fee. Right out of the box, my first impression is, it is a cheaper version of my old grinder but cost more. A little test run, the grinding mechanism operates smoothly. Con: The grinding mechanism protrudes below the bottom threads so you have to be careful sitting the top aside or it will tip, spilling your beans.
customer_reviews.author: Dobe Mom

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality materials and build
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this grinder for 2-1/2 months and the knob that holds the grind handle on has stripped threads and will no longer stay tightened. Also the keyed hole in the handle is so large, from day one, that if the knob that holds it onto the grind shaft isn't as tight as possible, it can spin on the shaft and not turn it. waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: KMG

customer_reviews.title: This just simply doesnt work well
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of a manual burr coffee grinder but it takes a stronger more dexterous person than I to make this thing work! I thought if i was just strong enough it would have a smoother action. But no matter how hard i tried or how careful i was i could not get it to grind. Back it went.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth N.

customer_reviews.title: My Khaw-Fee HG1B Grinder Was Worth the Investment
customer_reviews.text: This Khaw-Fee Grinder takes much longer than my old electric unit --- but produces a beautiful deep brown "color" of grind with all grains of ground coffee beans uniform in size. I mention color because my old electric coffee grinder delivered a non-uniform mass of ground beans. And the color was just not as nice looking. (I’ve been using the same source and blend of roasted whole coffee beans for the past six months.) Most important the taste of brewed coffee was noticeably enhanced with the use of this manual grinder. I don’t know why I put up with an electric grinder for so many years?
customer_reviews.author: jcadams

customer_reviews.title: Lots of work for little product
customer_reviews.text: Terrible disappointment. It took way too much grinding to get minuscule amounts of espresso-level grind. The porcelain burr worked OK but I saw and tasted no advantage over my regular 31 year old electric (Krups) grinder. No more eco-friendly than an electric grinder since you will sweat and use more electricity via air conditioning as much work as it takes to get this thing to produce.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Lickner

customer_reviews.title: My grinder of choice
customer_reviews.text: Researched others and saw that this one had a larger capacity, which meets my lifestyle. It takes me about 90 seconds to grind 4 tablespoons of beans. It looks like it would hold at least double that amount. Another nice thing about this one is you can grind your beans and save them in the grinder's glass receptor. It even has a separate lid. The quality looks good and it is easy and quick to adjust the fineness of the grind. I was using an electric blade grinder, and although quicker and easier, the inconsistency of the grind left a lot to be desired. This one gives me a consistent grind and the coffee definitely tastes better.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! Works just perfect for that perfect cup ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Works just perfect for that perfect cup of coffee. I have been using it for a full week read the instruction manual completely before using. I set mine for a semi fine grind (3 stops from fully closed) if you read the manual you will understand what I'm talking about. Your setting may be just + or - from my setting. This grinder is the best that I have tried. You won't be disappointed !
customer_reviews.author: Armand A. Desjardins

customer_reviews.title: This is a good coffee grinder for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good coffee grinder for the price. It produces a nice, even grind. It's easy to use (although my arm does get tired if I'm grinding a large batch of beans), and it's very easy to take apart and clean. I especially like that it is airtight, so I can store leftover grounds and they're still fresh tasting when I use them a couple of days later!
customer_reviews.author: Soccermomma

customer_reviews.title: I would certainly buy this product again and recommend it to anyone who loves fresh coffee.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the coffee grind is wonderful. The product is simple, well-designed and well made. It takes some getting used to you to get your settings the way you’d like. I am using a pour over style and need my grind to be fine, but still a little course. If that makes sense. Once I was dialed in to my settings, the grind was consistent and perfect for my needs. In the future, this company could consider a larger base which would be more stable when you’re holding it and could allow you to grind more coffee. But that’s just a little suggestion. I would certainly buy this product again and recommend it to anyone who loves fresh coffee.
customer_reviews.author: John E Bock

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small apartment with limited outlets - I plug a lot of things in so I thought this would be a good option to eliminate any more outlet use. So far, so good! I like the control I have choosing the texture of the grind with this. Having said that, I do agree with another reviewer that this should come in at least 2 sizes - one with a smaller width and then this one. I have small hands!
customer_reviews.author: C. Almanza

customer_reviews.title: Solid manual burr grinder, consistent grind!
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and you were considering one of the much more expensive manual burr grinders, I'd recommend you give this one a try first! It produces a consistent grind, and is well built. I have only used it for a few days so hoping it will stand up to the test of time! Only annoying thing: Man, grinding by hand does take time and strength. You can't really knock off a point for it, you gotta know what you are getting yourself into when you buy a manual burr grinder. Make it part of your daily morning ritual, else you will likely go electric at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: excellent little grinder!
customer_reviews.text: had it for about a month now, & i can attest to its' functionality and ease of use: first, it's adorable...it's super-easy to grind--& i have serious issues with grip/hand strength, arthritis, & cramping--and, with the top, if you accidentally grind a bit too much, it will stay fresh until tomorrow very easy to change grinds, from espresso to cold-brew chunky i love it
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Minton Haley

customer_reviews.title: Good Grinder For Larger Batches
customer_reviews.text: I picked this coffee grinder because it looked like it could handle larger batches of coffee. It has worked well and easily handles 4 cups of coffee (20 ounces). My camping percolater and my French press recommend coarse ground coffee. I don't use them that often (usually power outages and occasional camping trip), so I can't speak to durability. However, it seems well made and I expect it to last. My only suggestion would be some marking system on the adjustment nut for repeatability and a guide for setting the adjustment nut. However, the company encourages experimentation to create a brew to personal preference and probably considered a guide as unnecessary..
customer_reviews.author: SCGuy88

customer_reviews.title: Grinds the coffee beans well, but adjustments are not precise.
customer_reviews.text: It grinds coffee beans okay. But I can't really use it to make my cold brew coffee. I find that the grounds are not consistently even in size. I have tried adjusting it, but it is hard to be precise with it. I grind the beans to a coarse ground but there are some fine grounds that get into the batch as well. This causes the grounds to clog the filter when I go to drain the coffee from my cold brew container. I like it okay, but will use it for hot drip coffee as opposed to cold brew.
customer_reviews.author: klg_xn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grinder.  Use a power drill to save yourself some time with it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I'm a lazy coffee snob so I don't want to manually grind my beans, but I also want them freshly ground. My solution was to use my handy DeWalt drill to spin the grinder for me. Created an attachment with a threaded coupling so as to not damage the threads. Can now get a fine espresso grind in like 30-45 seconds. Was worried I'd damage the ceramic grinder doing this, but here we are 4 months later and it still works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: We like freshly ground coffee and this little grinder is perfect for our needs. It is well made, easy to adjust from espresso to cold brew grind and it is easy to clean up. Previous reviewers stated that the handle would come loose during grinding. We've had ours for about 3 months and after tightening the nut on top with a pair of pliers, it has yet to come loose.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Great basic coffee grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little grinder! Yes you do have to experiment with the manual settings of the burr grinder but it just takes a few beans for you to find the exact setting for your coffee preferences. I’m enjoying the fact that this a hand operated grinder as opposed to the electric I’ve been using. The “Khaw-Fee” has a very small footprint and it has made brewing really good coffee into a “Zen thing.” It took us years to go back to the basics but the journey was wort it. We are drinking less coffee but enjoying it more! Thanks Khaw-Fee!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Too large for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a coffee grinder for my French press. I thought this one would be ideal due to its larger size than the minis. However, it was not up to my expectations. It was so large and bulky. I also did not like the feel of the plastic lid. Keep in mind that this might be what you are looking for if you want a large capacity. It was just too big for me, and I did not like the materials felt.
customer_reviews.author: S K

customer_reviews.title: Better than aluminum tube type
customer_reviews.text: I've used the aluminum tube type for some time until it broke. Kind of a pain. The lid was finicky to get on and it didn't hold much coffee. It also seemed to take FOREVER to grind enough to use. I bought this hoping it would be as good as I was expecting. It was. Much faster, holds more coffee, has a lid for unused grounds and the grounds were all much more uniform than the other type. Can't speak of longevity but overall very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Better then my first one.
customer_reviews.text: I had one of those silver cylinder type grinders. It was ok for awhile, but I guess I used it too much. After a while it just work anymore. But this one has a ceramic burr. Easy assembly and once you set your grind size, you're golden. I use a stove top peculator and need a coarse grind. The first time I used it, it was a little too chunky. But just a half a turn to the right and all was good. I like the glass bowl because nothing sticks to it. Haven't had it that long but I love so far.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Well Made Grinder That I Regret Purchasing
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made burr grinder, and is perfect for the coffee connoisseur who has forty five minutes each morning to grind enough beans for one cup of joe. I figured this would be slower than an electric grinder, but I did not expect the amount of time and effort that would be necessary to use this. It is very solid and I will keep it to use for grinding herbs or something lighter. But it's not really practical as a daily coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Herrmann

customer_reviews.title: Great burr mill grinder for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what we were looking for! We wanted a burr mill coffee grinder without breaking the bank. It does take some effort to grind the beans but it is so worth it! There is a little cleaning brush that's included that helps us clean it in between uses. The one down side is that you don't really know what your grounds are going to look like until you start doing it. There aren't any numbers/guides on the dial that adjusts the coarseness of your grounds, so you just kind of have to do trial and error until you figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a blade grinder
customer_reviews.text: I hated my blade grinder, it never gave me a consistent grind. This grinder is far superior, even if I have to do it manually. My only dislike is that setting the grind coarseness is pretty much a trial and error situation. basically you have to turn the screw until you find a grind you like. but once it's set it's awesome. Cleaning is a bit of a chore too. You have to take the whole thing apart if you want a 'deep' clean.
customer_reviews.author: Steven O

customer_reviews.title: I was super excited to get this after seeing positive reviews and ...
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to get this after seeing positive reviews and my sister has a similar version...however not this brand. The bottom silicone pad does NOT STAY ON! It makes the churning motion even more awkward because it slips all over the counter and out of the bottom pad. Super unfortunate. I would go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Grayson Miles

customer_reviews.title: This little guy is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a great product! I love coffee but haven’t ground my own beans in years because I have a strong aversion to loud noises from electric grinders. I decided to try this manual grinder and have really gotten attached to it. It may even be therapeutic to crank the handle for a few minutes in the a.m. Word of advice: the first time you use it you may think it takes forever... just keep using it, you will acclimate to it. Additionally, the clear gasket that separates the grind setting gear from the burr mechanism is hard to see... be sure to keep up with it. Conclusion: support this small business and enjoy this great product!
customer_reviews.author: Hannah B

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: I love the jar that screws into the bottom of the grinder to catch and hold the ground coffee. It takes four to five minutes of grinding for a stout cup of coffee but the full flavor comes out of the beans. I use a fine espresso grind which takes longer to grind than a courser grind. No more electric grinders for me. I spent $149.00 on an Encore burr grinder that broke some motor mounts inside and wouldn't give me an espresso grind after two years. This one is inexpensive and well designed and made.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Montes

customer_reviews.title: Grind Adjust Nut Loosens while you crank
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this grinder so badly! It simple in design, compact, quiet, easy to clean.. but it's also maddening! The nut used to adjust the grind comes loose with every 5-10 revolutions of the crank handle. So, you are constantly stopping the grind to shove your fingers into the coffee beans to retighten. If you don't retighten, it comes so loose that whole coffee beans slip through. The nut holding the crank on comes loose as well with every 25 revolutions. Design flaw? Maybe I got a faulty product? I donno, but either way, very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: wildernessheals

customer_reviews.title: So Glad I Bought It
customer_reviews.text: The coffee tastes much better than when ground with my whiz grinder. The texture and consistency of the brew are also much better. For years I have heard that buhr ground coffee (like cereal grains) tastes better than whiz ground, even when fresh. I believed it too. When I finally got around to buying this thing I was amazed at how much better the coffee was (all other things being equal). The texture of the granules is also much more pleasant, an important factor if you ever want to make Turkish (or hobo) coffee. The liquor itself is also smoother and more pleasant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grinds well, but handle failed after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after our last grinder failed after a few years of use. This looked good and had great reviews though I think I prefer the tall cylinder style as they're easier to hold. Took a little playing around to get the grind how we liked but after that it was very consistent. Unfortunately the handle broke after just two weeks and basically 3 times using it. The plastic piece that you hold to turn the grinder broke right off. Can still turn the handle but it's obviously harder now. Guess well have to find another one.
customer_reviews.author: Calgeek

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: This cute little coffee grinder caught my eye and I purchased it as a Christmas gift for a friend living in Russia. Once it arrived and I checked it out the way to adjust the grind is so cumbersome and inaccurate it was difficult to get the fineness we wanted. In fact we never did. Looks are deceiving as is the case for this Coffee Grinder. Sorry, I wanted it to be great, but it wasn't. My return window is up so I'll just put it on my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: SLAPDASH SERVICE: Package was OPEN & DIRTY
customer_reviews.text: As you can see with you own wide-open eyes, the box was open, and some of the parts not very clean, when it arrived. It was clear that the product was not new, and I was sent a piece that was likely returned by someone else previously. The grinder is okay. You get what you paid for. The grind is not consistent, and the grind adjustments neither intuitive nor repeatable. I wanted to try out something cheap for my espresso machine. This one can work ok with dark roasts & a pressurized basket, which are easier to extract & slightly forgiving on the grind setting, respectively, but overall a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: D Coolios

customer_reviews.title: The grinding action is smooth and the grind easily adjustable. I had to back it off several ...
customer_reviews.text: Although it takes a bit of turning to get the proper amount for my 3 cup Moka Pot, it is more than worth it. The grinding action is smooth and the grind easily adjustable. I had to back it off several settings to get the fine grind I needed. I'm not sure what you would use the ultra-fine grind for as it is way too fine for any coffee maker. Perhaps there is a spice that needs to be like ultra-fine powdered sugar.
customer_reviews.author: CatCol

customer_reviews.title: Nice grinder
customer_reviews.text: Product is well made but the amount of beans I need to grind for my wife and myself takes me about 20 mins or more. Even if I'm retired I don't want to spend twenty mins every morning to grind enough for 10-12 cups of coffee. I will keep it though, in case the power goes out!
customer_reviews.author: konaram

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I use the grinder for grinding dog kibble. My little guys don’t chew their food so I chew it up for them. It grinds more quickly than my previous machine which is a plus. The only thing I don’t like is that the top screws onto the bottom with too many turns. Seems unnecessary. Otherwise it works great.
customer_reviews.author: slipsiu

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I had a terrible time trying to get this to work. By the time I was done grinding one little jar I felt like I had carpel tunnel in both hands. Will be returning and buying something better.
customer_reviews.author: gazza212

customer_reviews.title: I'm gonna be getting more of these!
customer_reviews.text: I love its shape and design. Grinds well! I plan on getting more of these grinders for spices and such. on a side note, I was born near Sherman, Texas at Perrin AFB a now closed Air Force Base. And spent 12 years in the tech industry literally living in a cubical in Las Colinas... ...I'll be glad to support you with any business I can send your way.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Poor materials and construction
customer_reviews.text: The burrs are good quality, I'll begin with that. The cover is a good idea, it keeps beans from jumping/popping out. But the threaded assembly is just really poor quality. Mine has stripped out just under 1 year after purchase. I am sure a machinist could save it by recutting the threads for another nut size, but it is basically a paperweight now.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Stick N. Mud

customer_reviews.title: Its quiet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder to use when I wake early in the morning. My electric grinder is so loud my neighbor bangs on the wall. Not any more. It does an excellent job of grinding the beans. I grind 1/8 cup of beans at a time to get the amount I need. Love it
customer_reviews.author: brendan j mackey

customer_reviews.title: Good product and responsive seller
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived with a defect in the shaft of the burr assembly, which prevented the handle from seating properly during grinding. I contacted the seller, who responded very quickly and, rather than make me return the item, sent me a replacement assembly, which arrived quickly. I replaced the assembly, and the grinder now works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jose G. Mendels

customer_reviews.title: Grind for a better you
customer_reviews.text: I first bought an electric grinder and did not like it. It ground the coffee way too fine. I found that with this manual grinder to change the grind size was really easy. I also like doing more manual chores and relying less on technology. It does take a couple mins to grind up enough for a pot, but doing it manually works muscles. Working muscles makes us stronger. So technically this grinder is making me a better person. Thank you for making us better.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to take apart and maintain
customer_reviews.text: Easy to take apart and maintain, and produces an even grind. Took me a few tries to figure out how it gauged grounds size - this was my first manual coffee grinder - but I'm very pleased with how quick and easy it is now that I have it on my favorite setting. The separate storage piece is fantastic, too, and a great way for me to grind coffee the night before if I'll be up before the hubby. It's great quality, and seems like it'll last for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Good product, GREAT customer service
customer_reviews.text: Produces a great grind for my cold brew coffee. Much better than my electric blade grinder. Easy to use, I like the container cap for unused grounds. Like others mentioned, my handle fell off - but contacted customer service and received a new handle in 2 days. The new one is much better - seems like they have the design flaw fixed. Other than the one issue, a near perfect hand grinder. Don't hesitate to buy this grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: The best part of my morning coffee
customer_reviews.text: I love this grinder! Grinding coffee by hand changes coffee drinking from utilitarian to ritual and the coffee break is really a break. I love the fragrance of the freshly ground beans and the size of the grounds is just right every time.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, and some helpful extras
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been wanting a good burr grinder for a while but I am sensitive to noises. I don’t know why I didn’t think to get hand crank until now, but I’m glad I found this one. Easy set-up, I ground a few test beans to get the right grind for a French press and I’m all set. Some features that I really appreciate are the extra cap in case I grind more than I need, I can securely cover them for later and the rubbery cap for use while grinding. I remember electric grinders as noisy and messy and this is neither of those. Really good purchase .
customer_reviews.author: Birdy

customer_reviews.title: This a nice, compact
customer_reviews.text: This a nice, compact, easy to use manual grinder. I like how the glass bottom enables me to see how much coffee I have ground. You could also store ground coffee in the glass base with the included cover. Of course, this does require more time than an electric grinder. However, the founder of this company wants coffee lovers to enjoy all parts of the coffee making process, much like the Japanese have their green tea ritual. I do think that manual grinding adds to the idea of making that perfect cup. Fresh 100% kona, manually ground, brewed on a pour over with fresh water at the perfect temperature. Its like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Consistent coarse grind for french press
customer_reviews.text: I grind beans coarsly for use in my french press and this does a fantastic job of that. I was hesitant of buying this due to complaints that it didn’t work very well for coarse grinding, but now I’m chalking it up to user error, as this provides a very consistent and ideal coarse grind. The only complaint is with the rubber piece that goes around the glass bottom, it doesn’t stay attached very well, but still serves its purpose regardless.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder - not junk
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hand grinder more than month ago and have used it for a month. i dont give many reviews but this product is perfect. I've been grinding for epresso for 15 years, in store and using electric burr grinders at home and this little guy produced the best cups I have ever made - both caffinated and decaf. Its a bit old timey to hand grind but this grinder produces beautiful, aromatic, consistent grind. Its super simple - an elegant design - and easy to adjust and use. Grinding fine for expresso does take time but its totally worth it. PS Im a real person no shill or influencer.
customer_reviews.author: MemryB

customer_reviews.title: Quick quiet and easy to use. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little gizmo! I brace it between my knees and grind my coffee to the perfect grind. You don’t have to brace it that way but I’m sitting on my couch, so it was easiest for me that way. I use an aeropress so the grind is very fine. I was impressed with how even the grind was and how easy it was for me to do! Really well made and simple to use. Yay quick quiet and easy!!
customer_reviews.author: GeminiS

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: It is a slow process. I keep the grinder near my desk and spin it my spare time. It probably takes 5 minutes or so to grind enough for a full pot of coffee. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Queen of Hearts

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying the Khaw-Fee HG1B Manual Coffee Grinder, and use it daily. Once set, the grind coarseness seems to remain consistent enough. Initially setting it and changing it takes a bit of trial and error. Changing back to a previous grind is hit and miss. I would have gladly paid more if the grinder had a reliable coarseness indicator that I could quickly dial to. Other than that, I think it's great and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Raye Newmen

customer_reviews.title: Great manual coffee grinder!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this coffee grinder to replace and old electric grinder that was starting to fail. This grinder gives a better grind for coarse grind than the electric one did even on it's most coarse setting. The coarse grind is so much better for use with a french press. The bottom jar can be used to store the coffee in, so I don't need another jar on the counter. I am able to get about 4 scoops and only drink one very large cup a day, so the coffee stores in the jar for a few days at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect personal coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: With this grinder you can adjust the grind to perfectly match your requirements. Unlike electric blade grinders, with this one once the grind is set the results always come out the same. I am using mine to grind beans for refilling Nespresso capsules. Two minutes a day of grinding is enough to refill five capsules. Made of stainless steel, ceramic, plastic and glass there is nothing to rust. Should last along time if handled properly.
customer_reviews.author: Fieldman

customer_reviews.title: Quality manual grinder.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of the coffee grinder! Is made of quality parts and works really well. Seems to give an even grind to the coffee. However, it was a bit much for this 63 year old woman to use. Someone with more muscle would love this grinder. Gave it 5 stars because it is a quality piece of equipment. The only thing that it needs is a way of marking the adjustment so you don’t have to guess where to lock it in for the grind you want each time.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi Jody

customer_reviews.title: Great piece for the low price.
customer_reviews.text: A really nice grinder for the low price. Gets a nice, uniform grind and it's amazing how much better a fresh, hand grind can make coffee taste. Company is in the US, product is made in China, but is pretty sturdy. The basin holds enough coffee to make a full pot of coffee. Remember, a hand grind takes a bit of time to get consistent, fine ground coffee for a drip pot, so be patient and the results will be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chicks &amp; Hens

customer_reviews.title: Knob on Handle poorly riveted and fell off on first use
customer_reviews.text: Really? The handle is cheaply made and you REALLY NEED IT TO GRIND COFFEE. The knob is poorly riveted on the handle and fell off after first use! No way to put it back in securely. From what I am reading, Amazon will not offer a replacement part and it's too much hassle to return from where I live. How this is "Amazon's Choice" I really do not know. Many others have complained of the same thing from what I see in previous comments.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good manual grinder - hold tight to the jar
customer_reviews.text: Great manual grinder for course grind coffee for use in a French press. The finer-grind setting works well also. Can get to be a little wobbly while grinding so hold on the glass jar tightly. Company has put some thought into this design with the cover and non-slip base. Good stuff. With it being a U.S. company and the reasonable price, I will be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good design, great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for about a month now and I'm really impressed with the design and construction. Much nicer than an earlier purchase of one of the cylinder hand-grinders. It is more comfortable to hold and turn the handle to grind. There is some trial and error in setting the coarseness for a french press pot, but once you get it right, the grind setting stays locked in better. Solid plastic, glass, metal and silicone materials. This was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: GIS Hokie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product, but needs to be made in USA.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be able to set the grind and my electric grinder couldn't do that but my new Khaw-Fee grinder sure does. I selected it over all the others because of the reviews it got. I'm very pleased with its performance and it is made well. Only one question... if the owner of Khaw-Fee manufacturing lives in Texas, why does it say Made in China on the box?? I would pay more for my grinder if it were to be manufactured in the U.S. of A!!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine R

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder, horrible quality jar
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is really good quality, however the glass has chipped twice now. We have decided to not use it anymore since the first time, I actually found the glass in my food (we didn't realize it chipped until this happened) and the second time my husband just slightly hit the grinder against the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Insert Name Here

customer_reviews.title: Great for small amounts of coffe
customer_reviews.text: Bought this grinder to make cold brew so i needed coarse grinds. While not the most consistent grind it does a lot better job than my non conical burr grinder. Only 2 complaints I have is that the top nut for the handle likes to loosen itself when in use (use reverse threads and shouldn't be a problem) and its almost impossible to keep the same grind settings after cleaning as there are not visible or preset adjustment settings. There is a screw that moves up and down a threaded arm, with an adjustment lock that slides in to the grooves of the adjustment knob.
customer_reviews.author: TheKaptin

customer_reviews.title: Great taste but a bit of effort required
customer_reviews.text: It would be easier to use this unit if the jar was larger and/or there was a different texture. I have to hold it with a jar opener while grinding. It’s hard to hold on to it. The flavor of the coffee is well-worth the effort as it really does taste better than coffee from the electric grinder but it does take a while to hand grind so I cannot use it for everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila R

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: 2 stars for being an affordable option. The grind was uneven, and took a really long time. I find it impossible to get consistent sized grounds without it being on the smallest setting, which isn't great for my french press. It is awkward to hold while grinding, i find the need to sit and hold the grinder in my lap. You would have to readjust the ground setting after every wash. Honestly I'm going to just keep using my blender for coffee grounds until I can invest in a quality grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Morrison

customer_reviews.title: High quality, low cost ceramic burr grinder
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. It takes some experimentation to set the burr for the desired grind, but I had it down by about the third use. Easy to clean and I love the fact that it can use standard Mason jars for storage so I can grind a couple of kinds of beans for the day's use and store them in small sealed jars. The only change I would make would be to make the clear plastic washer black or a color because it's easy to misplace (about invisible) if you drop it when cleaning the grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect grinder for espresso
customer_reviews.text: Perfect grinder for espresso. My electric burr grinder could never quite get it fine enough. Takes a little muscle power, but the smell of the coffee makes it all worthwhile. My only negative is the silicone bottom does not fit very well and tends to fall off...which my puppy immediately steals to chew on. Other than that, what a find! I don't think I will use the electric grinder ever again! Excited to see what other products you guys will come up with. Love to support fellow Texans!
customer_reviews.author: PLL

customer_reviews.title: Maintenance is easy by using the included brush or with a new ...
customer_reviews.text: A simple and well designed hand cranked coffee grinder. The size of the coffee grind can be adjusted with the flat star shaped nut that controls the depth of the ceramic stone. Maintenance is easy by using the included brush or with a new toothbrush to clean off the residual grounds. It is a bit of a workout to grind the coffee beans but the payout is worth it. The only improvement would be to switching the clear plastic washer with a brightly colored one. I've managed to lose this part a few times. Including a few extra washers would have been appreciated. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Joe C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for me
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is great for this new guy. Had electric blade but way to inconsistent with eveness. I marked one of the tabs on the adjust nut so I could dial in to my grind more easily. Now where I want to be for drip. For the price just right for me.
customer_reviews.author: Martyd

customer_reviews.title: Well built!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder feels very well made, much more solid than any other manual burr grinder I’ve purchased. It has a huge capacity and changing grind sizes is very easy. It is a little large in the hand so should be held on a table top to grind, as it is difficult to hold in your hand and grind. Not an issue, just a consideration. I haven’t yet cleaned it but the included brush will make that a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Miller

customer_reviews.title: Happy So Far!
customer_reviews.text: I like the extras this grinder comes with like the silicone base, the burr brush and the portable jar! The portable/sealable jar was one of the main contributing factors in my purchase. Make sure to use small increments of beans while dialing in becuase the difference between extra fine and extra coarse isn't as many rotations away as you think! Looking forward to using the product more and more. The follow up email from the owner was a great touch as well. Glad to see they are a Texas company but the directions had some grammar errors that made me believe it was translated from another language.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Bourn

customer_reviews.title: Fine little mill, but handle needs a rework
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder 3 months ago and have used it 1-2 time everyday since. It's an OK little mill and the glass container holds enough ground coffee for about 2 1/2 full Chemex brews. My biggest complaint is in the construction of the handle. Out of the box, the tightening nut that holds the handle to the mill vibrates loose during use and had to constantly be re-tightened. Lately, the eye of the handle itself has begun to stretch and has started skipping and not turning the mill during finer grinds. It would just have been nice if a slightly harder grade of steel would have been used on the handle, instead of it wearing out after 90-100 uses.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Gets jammed and squeaky after 8 months
customer_reviews.text: First off, this grinder never produced a consistent grind. I have a similar name-brand grinder that does well, but the shaft on this one is wobbly and does not grind a consistent size (and it never did). Nowadays, 8 months later, the grinder consistently gets jammed and produces a squeaky noise, but does not grind hardly at all. My name-brand grinder has lasted 5 years, but this one didn't last. I've tried to clean it out occasionally, but it just gets jammed up again. It may be partly due to grinding lighter-roast coffees (dark beans tend to just crumble), but I'd expect that a grinder should be capable of handling it.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Baustian

customer_reviews.title: Makes a Big Difference in Morning Brew
customer_reviews.text: I'm really surprised by what a huge difference hand ground beans make in my morning brew. I have always used a motorized burr grinder, but the hand grinder gets rid of all of the bitterness. The Khaw-fee unit is really easy to use - place beans in the top rotate the handle. Adjusting the thickness is pretty easy to do, but now that I've found my preferred grind level, I just keep it set. Only had for a few days, but this does everything that I wanted and at a much lower price that other comparable grinders.
customer_reviews.author: NS22

customer_reviews.title: Fresh ground coffee beans make the best morning brew!
customer_reviews.text: Don't dislike a thing! Using a hand grinder to make the freshest cup of coffee and a pour over "coffee brewer" will save on my electric bill. I only have to use the microwave to heat my water and no electricity to actually brew the coffee. I also will no longer be adding to the trash problem by using the "one use then throw away" plastic K-cups or similar items. Any one who is skeptical of making coffee this way should keep in mind the taste and aroma of the fresh ground beans used in the coffee shops, and this way you won't pay an arm and a leg for a simple cup of coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Rita A. Shiflet

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: Hand grinding takes a little more time than using a grinder, but the grind is more even and is now part of my morning. This item is well-made, grinder itself can be screwed onto a regular mouth mason jar, silicone base is both a safety device as well as a convenience to keep the jar from moving.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Croll

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for coffee snobs (like me)
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly the kind of grinder I was hoping to find. Compact, attractive, and functional. Adjusting the grind is kind of fiddly, but it's the kind of fiddly that's easy to enjoy. I'll definitely keep an eye out for new offerings.
customer_reviews.author: Darin L Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: I purchase the grinder when the switch on my electric grinder went out. I have yet to determine how many turns of the handle will make just the right cup of coffee for my taste, but appreciate that the grinder is quiet and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased an expensive electric grinder that broke down after a couple of uses. This manual grinder works great! It’s easy to use and grinds the coffee beans uniformly , the electric grinder couldn’t even do that. It’s more work, but well worth the effort. I would recommend this and would purchase again!
customer_reviews.author: lovestoshop

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I love the size. It is easy to hold the jar in one hand and turn the handle with the other. I can sit in my recliner and watch TV while cranking up fresh coffee for an 8 cup pot. I am older and have some hand disability, but the strength and dexterity needed to turn the crank is minimal. It is surprisingly satisfying to feel the crunch of the coffee beans as you turn the handle to grind. If you love fresh coffee and simple moments of peaceful pleasure, this inexpensive, well-made, manual coffee grinder is worth trying. And it is lovely to be able to control so much about the process.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn W. Gilliland

customer_reviews.title: A really nice addition to my life.
customer_reviews.text: I Love my Khaw-Fee grinder! My first experience of it was when my neighbor, with whom I roast coffee, loaned me his to try. I loved it so much that I ordered my own. Since I am the only coffee drinker in my home, grinding every morning is not an issue, but a really wonderful experience. Hand ground and then hand pressed, one cup at a time is simply the finest cup of coffee ever! Thanks you guys for a great way to start my day.
customer_reviews.author: Alanart

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The grinder has been durable and pretty smooth to crank. I even let my 7-year-old try turning the handle a few times while I held it, and he did just fine with it. I can imagine it would take quite a bit of trial and error and then practice to switch back-and-forth from different grind sizes (since it is just a bolt/nut combo sort of thing), but thankfully we rarely switch up our brewing methods and have found the size that works best for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use perfect for fine grind for espresso one day and coarse for French press the next. I love the added ritual of grinding my coffee before I make it and it doesn’t take very long at all. I also love that the glass jar has a lid in case I want to grind coffee in advance and keep it fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Well-made, Works well, All-round Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This grinder is absolutely perfect! I can coarse grind for my cold brew coffee AND medium grind for our Melitta cone. We can also take it with us when we're in our RV--we camp off the grid & have had to suffer with canned coffee until now! This grinder is very well made, the instructions for adjusting the grind are very clear & the company is a U.S. small business! What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of using this for coffee beans. I am new to the grind you own coffee thing and I think I am really going to like this! Love the freshness keeping the beans whole until use.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design and quality
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product daily for 2 ,months and I am happy with it's performance. It takes about 5 minutes (at 1 rotation per second) to grind 1/3 cup of beans to "pourover" size particles. The product design is well thought out and the individual parts are well made. One caveat: You use a trial and error process to adjust the burrs to achieve the particle size you desire. There are no setting marks to reference. If you want to vary particle size for a couple different brewing processes you will need patience.
customer_reviews.author: H Miller

customer_reviews.title: So display-able!
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves the look of the coffee grinder! We are looking forward to using it. (We've bought pre-ground coffee for so long that have a LOT. We haven't used the coffee grinder yet.) I love, though, that it is beautiful AND functional. I'm also pretty excited that it isn't one more appliance that will sit in a cupboard. It will be displayed on a shelf so proudly! I also love how it's dishwasher safe. That's one less thing that I have to hand wash.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Rohrer
